title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Dyson Promo Codes: 20% Off in September 2025
items.description: Get 20% off with a Dyson coupon code, plus save up to $250 on vacuums, Airwraps, and more.

items.title: Here’s the tech powering ICE’s deportation crackdown
items.description: From phone spyware and facial recognition to forensic phone hacking technology to databases and more, this tech powers Trump's deportation machine.

items.title: Tesla board chair calls debate over Elon Musk’s $1T pay package ‘a little bit weird’
items.description: Tesla's board chair is defending a proposed 10-year, $1 trillion compensation package for CEO Elon Musk.

items.title: Dell 27 Plus 4K Review (S2725QS): The Monitor Almost Everyone Should Buy
items.description: Dell has made the definitive 4K monitor, and it’s selling for an irresistible price. What’s not to like?

items.title: Pilot union urges FAA to reject Rainmaker’s drone cloud-seeding plan
items.description: Rainmaker wants to use flares to seed clouds — the airline pilots' union says it won't be safe.

items.title: How a 2020 Rolex Collection Changed the Face of Watch Design
items.description: Five years on, the luxury watch brand's bright idea is still being copied.

items.title: 6 Best Digital Notebooks, Tablets, and Smart Pens (2025)
items.description: These nifty tools combine the ease of jotting notes by hand with the power of saving them digitally.

items.title: xAI reportedly lays off 500 workers from data annotation team
items.description: Elon Musk's AI startup says it's shifting focus from generalist AI tutors to specialists.

items.title: California lawmakers pass AI safety bill SB 53 — but Newsom could still veto
items.description: The state's landmark safety bill sets new transparency requirements for large AI companies.

items.title: What Are Ebike ‘Classes’ and What Do They Mean?
items.description: Electric bikes are broadly designated as Class 1, 2, or 3. What class it is determines what’s legal to ride and where.
